intro: Oxyspora sumatrana, commonly known as the Sumatran oxyspora, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Orchidaceae, commonly known as the orchid family. The plant is characterized by its delicate, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of white and yellow. It thrives in humid, tropical environments and is often found in forested areas. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
